head.supplied: October 13th [189]6 ¶ Dear Mr ¶ Leuhmann ¶ ¶ I with all other most most deeply feel the loss sustained by the death of our old friend the Baron, who for so many years has held the position of head o...

div.p: From Frederick Bailey to Georg Luehmann
Letter press copy book 3, p. 675, Queensland Herbarium, Brisbane.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: I with all other most most deeply feel the loss sustained by the death of our old friend the Baron, who for so many years has held the position of head of the botanical profession in Australia. You however who were so much with him must feel the loss most acutely. You will remember that when I was in Melbourne a few months ago, that the late Baron promised me some specimens of some New Guinea orchids, which he was expecting to be returned from Europe if these have been received by you I shall be glad of what can be spared

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
